column4: has anyone had trouble running flash applications/animations on firefox or epiphany? any time i attempt to go to a site with such things it overloads my cpu and cant effectively render anything. I've tried gnash swfdec and adobe plugins but issue still persists. My proprietary drivers for my graphics card are activated so they shouldn't be the issue. I'm running the 8.10 release
be->there's codecs you can get for those in the package manager you can install
ben*
so nobody can help me with the flash issue? :/
okay
simple animations it renders, but complex ones that i know what are supposed to look like, it nearly crashes my computer.

it would be nice if ubuntu had torrent support for downloading installation updates and packages inside the synaptic manager... the current bandwidth to the official site to download such things is worse than my emergency dialup ISP :<
have you tried using another server? I think you can switch it in the app where you select the sources/repositories (forgot its english name). System->Administrations->Sources/Repositories?
ah yes, i see! thank you. learning new stuff everyday.
yw =)
what kind of issues?
well that's a kernel panic. I get LOTS of those if I try to read (not when writing!) files on one of my NTFS disks, which I know has damaged clusters.

ok, then it's probably something else. Most likely hardware related as it gets to a kernel panic, I'm no expert on kernel panics, but I think it's possible to get a crash dump when it occurss, then someone could perhaps trace it back to the driver/program crashing.
don't think so. But I have added an icon to force-crashing a program to one of my panels. It's there if you right click and "add to panel".
you could also use ctrl+alt+f1 to get to the terminal, if the window manager froze and you can't start xterm, and then try "killall appname"
what exactly did you do=
ok, all this to the same hdd? Or do you have more?
ok. Have you run a disk check on them?
random guess here, but could it be a RAM issue? Or perhaps related to the graphics card. Those graphichs bugs might be a clue..
maybe a good idea if you don't feel like reinstalling again. Not easy to find the source of problems like that when no hardware has changed recently...
no, not that I'm aware of.
what I meant was really "if you don't feel like reinstalling the same version..."
